conclusion: The problem involves calculating the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on a ν-shaped current-carrying wire placed in a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of the wire.
The wire has a total length of 2l, is bent into a ν shape with equal side lengths, and has an included angle of 60°.
The magnetic induction intensity is B, and the current passing through the wire has an intensity of I.

premise: The wire is bent into a ν shape with equal side lengths and an included angle of 60°.
conclusion: The effective length of the wire in the magnetic field is 2l × sin(30°) = l.

premise: The effective length of the wire in the magnetic field is l, and the formula for Ampere force is F = B × I × effective length.
conclusion: The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the ν-shaped current-carrying wire is F = B × I × l.

premise: The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the ν-shaped current-carrying wire is F = B × I × l.
conclusion: The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on this ν-shaped current-carrying wire is 1.
